item.title: Broken slabs next to morrisons, 20th February
item.description:
This has been like this for a few months and I have seen people fall over it. All it will take is for someone to sue the council. It’s very dangerous as it’s such a busy pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 264-276, Walworth Road, Walworth, Greater London

item.title: Large, dangerous and vehicle damaging pothole, 20th February
item.description:
This pothole was reported by others earlier in the month. I went over this last night not knowing it was there, as it cannot be seen coming from Orpington direction in the dark as it’s the other side of the raised hump, I thought my car wheel had come off as it made such a loud noise. I stopped the car and went back to see what it was. Photo attached. This should have been resolved last week! Please I will be seeking damages if any damage caused by this pothole on my 6 month old car!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Main Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Pavement Damage and Illegal Parking Obstruction, 20th February
item.description:
This stretch of pavement has been hazardous for years. Multiple neighbouring properties are undergoing building works, with skips regularly kept on front gardens and heavy lorries delivering materials. Vehicles are repeatedly driven over the grass verge, which has now become a mud mess, contributing to pavement damage and surface breakage. Water constantly flows across the pavement, mixing with mud and creating a downhill slip hazard. The area is frequently filthy and extremely difficult, if not impossible, for pedestrians to navigate safely. This issue has been reported to Enfield Council on numerous occasions, yet there has been zero enforcement. Additionally, traffic cones are often left on the road to reserve parking for builders. These cones are not legal and present an obstruction on a busy A road used by buses and constant traffic. Hazardous materials, including cones, are being left on the carriageway, creating further safety concerns. This situation requires urgent investigation and enforcement action.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Winchmore Hill Road, Southgate
Report on FixMyStreet
